title: ContactView
description: <font color="#4f81bd">ContactView</font> is a simplified view of a GeoSciML <font color="#4f81bd">MappedFeature</font> with key property values from an associated <font color="#4f81bd">Contact</font> feature.  These properties are summarised as labels (unconstrained character strings) or arbitrarily selected classifiers to be used for thematic mapping purposes. The latter are the properties suffixed with “_uri” and will contain URIs referring to controlled concepts in published vocabularies.

identifier.title: identifier
identifier.description:
Globally unique <font color="#4f81bd">identifier:Primitive::CharacterString</font> shall uniquely identifies a tuple within the dataset. Identifiers shall be formatted as URI according to RFC 3986.  This URI could be used to access more detailed, such as a GeoSciML Basic, representation of the feature.
It should have the same value as the corresponding GeoSciML MappedFeature identifier if available.

name.title: name
name.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">name:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports the display name for the Contact.

description.title: description
description.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">description:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports the description of the Contact, typically taken from an entry on a geological map legend.

contactType.title: contactType
contactType.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">contactType:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports the type of <font color="#4f81bd">Contact</font> (as defined in GeoSciML) as a human readable label.  To report an identifier from a controlled vocabulary, <font color="#4f81bd">contactType_uri</font> shall be used.

observationMethod.title: observationMethod
observationMethod.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">observationMethod:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports a metadata snippet indicating how the spatial extent of the feature was determined. <font color="#4f81bd">ObservationMethod</font> is a convenience property that provides a quick and simple approach to observation metadata when data are reported using a feature view (as opposed to observation view).

positionalAccuracy.title: positionalAccuracy
positionalAccuracy.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">positionalAccuracy:Primitive::CharacterString </font>reports quantitative values defining the radius of an uncertainty buffer around a <font color="#4f81bd">MappedFeature</font> (e.g., a <font color="#4f81bd">positionalAccuracy</font> of 100 m for a line feature defines a buffer polygon of total width 200 m centred on the line).

source.title: source
source.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">source:Primitive::CharacterString</font> contains a text describing feature-specific details and citations to source materials, and if available providing URLs to reference material and publications describing the contact feature. This could be a short text synopsis of key information that would also be in the metadata record referenced by <font color="#4f81bd">metadata_uri</font>.

contactType_uri.title: contactType_uri
contactType_uri.description: The property <font color="#4f81bd">contactType_uri:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports a URI referring to a controlled concept from a vocabulary defining the <font color="#4f81bd">Contact</font> types.

specification_uri.title: specification_uri
specification_uri.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">specification_uri:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports a URI referring the GeoSciML <font color="#4f81bd">Contact</font> feature that describes the instance in detail.

metadata_uri.title: metadata_uri
metadata_uri.description: If present, the property <font color="#4f81bd">metadata_uri:Primitive::CharacterString</font> reports a URI referring to a metadata record describing the provenance of data.

genericSymbolizer.title: genericSymbolizer
genericSymbolizer.description: If present, the <font color="#4f81bd">genericSymbolizer:Primitive::CharacterString</font> property contains an identifier for a symbol from standard (locally or community defined) symbolization scheme for portrayal.

any-1.title: any
any-1.description: A data provider can add an arbitrary number of extra properties, as long as the instance is conformant to GML Simple Feature Level 0.

any-2.title: any
any-2.description: A data provider can add an arbitrary number of extra properties, as long as the instance is conformant to GML Simple Feature Level 0.
